column4: can someone recommend a windows xp freeware program to burn a ubuntu Iso file onto a cd?
you might try magicISO
thanks
i have gotten magiciso
have you used it?
I have, but it's been a while
doesn't it let you burn from a preexisting iso?
i don't understand your quesntion
you have already downloaded the ISO for ubuntu, right?
yes, i have
look for an option in magicISO to burn an image to disc
I don't remember if there are size restrictions on burning or not though
looks like a good choice to me
but the tutorial at  http://www.magiciso.com/tutorials/miso-burniso.htm doesn't use that button. please take a look at the link
one sec
well, you want it to be bootable for sure
lol... you should just be able to burn it to a disc and have it boot
let me look over the directions quick... not done yet
maybe, i should follow http://www.magiciso.com/tutorials/miso-makebootablecd.htm
just click the option to burn from iso. I think that should work fine.
there is a button that says "burn cd/dvid with ISO", but no button that says "burn cd/dvd from ISO".
try that one
